title: HTML Editors
gp1: Web pages can be created and modified by using professional HTML editors.
gp2: However, for learning HTML we recommend a simple text editor like Notepad (PC) or TextEdit (Mac).
gp3: We believe that using a simple text editor is a good way to learn HTML.
gp4: Follow the steps below to create your first web page with Notepad or TextEdit.
gp5: You can use either .htm or .html as file extension. There is no difference; it is up to you.
wp1: With our free online editor, you can edit the HTML code and view the result in your browser.
wp2: It is the perfect tool when you want to test code fast. It also has color coding and the ability to save and share code with others:
wp3: Click on the 'Try it Yourself' button to see how it works.
wp4: If you want to create your own website and save your code online, try our free website builder, called W3schools Spaces:
